meanings.definition: Soaked in a seasoned liquid mixture before cooking.
meanings.sent1: The chicken was marinaded in a tasty sauce overnight.
meanings.sent2: She always marinaded her steak in a special blend of herbs and spices.
meanings.sent3: The vegetables were marinaded so long, they started dancing in the pan!
meanings.sent4: His mind was marinaded in memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The fish was marinaded until it practically sang with flavor.

meanings.sent1: The marinaded chicken smelled delicious as it cooked on the grill.
meanings.sent2: The steak was perfectly marinaded and ready to be grilled.
meanings.sent3: The marinaded vegetables looked like a colorful work of art on the plate.
meanings.sent4: Her words were marinaded with kindness and understanding.
meanings.sent5: The air was filled with the aroma of the marinaded meat sizzling on the barbecue.

meanings.sent1: She liked to marinade her tofu in a tangy sauce.
meanings.sent2: He decided to marinade the chicken in a zesty marinade for extra flavor.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally marinaded his apron in sauce instead of the meat!
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were marinading in uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The idea marinaded in his mind until it was perfectly seasoned with creativity.
